CheckTitle: Checks whether a DMS endpoint has SSL enabled or not
Description: This check ensures that AWS Database Migration Service (DMS) endpoints have SSL enabled for secure data transmission.
Risk: Without SSL, data transmitted between the DMS endpoint and the database is not encrypted, potentially exposing sensitive information.

Code.Console: 1. Open the AWS DMS console. 2. Navigate to 'Endpoints'. 3. Select the endpoint. 4. Click 'Modify'. 5. Under 'SSL mode', select 'Require SSL'. 6. Click 'Modify'.

Recommendation.Text: Enable SSL for all DMS endpoints to ensure secure data transmission.
